page.title: 06PORTALS MILL
page.content: {Portals Mill} Portal's Mill produces bank note paper from cotton waste. The paper is exported to about 130 countries around the world; 80% ends up abroad. The present mill was built in 1920. The demand for bank note paper will diminish because cheques and plastic cards are used more and more. From 700 to 750 workers are employed. Not all the jobs are skilled. A shift work system is operated and the average worker does 37 and a half hours a week. Salaries are quite good. Employees have five weeks holiday a year. The Queen's Award for Industry has been won on two occasions. These awards are given for export drive and technological innovation. The Mill is the largest bank note paper mill in the world.
